conclusion: Understanding the graph with x/t on y-axis and t on x-axis.
Equation for displacement in uniformly accelerated motion: x = v_0 t + 1/2 a t^2.
Dividing displacement equation by t to get x/t = v_0 + 1/2 a t.
Graph of x/t versus t should be a straight line with slope 1/2 a and y-intercept v_0.
Y-intercept of the graph is 10 m/s.
Using points (-2, 0) and (0, 10) to calculate slope.
Relating slope to acceleration: 1/2 a = 5, so a = 10 m/s^2.
